title: NEET PG result: NBEMS disqualifies 22 candidates; here is why

Additionally, 11 FMGE aspirants faced disqualification. NBEMS emphasized that using cancelled results for admission, employment, or registration is unlawful. The move underscores the board’s commitment to exam integrity amid rising scrutiny over transparency.

title: 'Priya Kapur behaving like Cinderella's stepmother': What Karisma's kids told HC
description: In a Delhi High Court inheritance battle, Sunjay Kapur's children from ex-wife Karisma Kapoor accused his current wife, Priya Kapur, of behaving like "Cinderella's stepmother" and usurping assets. They allege Priya presented a forged will to secure a larger share of the Rs 30,000 crore estate, putting the children in danger.

7-year-old Ukrainian child killed after Russia launches missile and drone strike
description: Kyiv faced a massive Russian assault Friday, with ballistic missiles and drones targeting the capital's critical infrastructure, causing widespread power outages and wounding at least nine. The national energy grid is under severe attack, according to officials.  Meanwhile, Zaporizhzhia also suffered drone strikes. Moscow's intensified aerial campaign aims to sow chaos, while Ukraine retaliates with strikes on Russian territory.

description: The sides appeared closer than they have been in months to ending a war that has killed tens of thousands of Palestinians, reduced much of Gaza to rubble, brought famine to parts of the territory and left dozens of hostages, living and dead, in Gaza

title: ‘Awarded for nothing’: Trump hits out at Obama over Nobel Peace Prize win
description: President Trump, eyeing the Nobel Peace Prize, criticized Barack Obama's award while highlighting his role in a US-brokered peace deal between Israel and Hamas. The agreement, which secured the release of hostages and Palestinian prisoners, was announced as Trump prepared to travel to Egypt for its signing.

title: A pilgrim’s progress | Review of A Return to Self by Aatish Taseer
description: Aatish Taseer’s travel writings seek answers for both historical puzzles and questions about his ‘exile’

title:
Natarajasundaram Pillai, the nagaswaram
player who excelled in complex rhythms
description:
Pallavi Natarajasundaram Pillai, as he was known, was renowned for mallaris. The available recordings are an invaluable documentation of his style and a testimony to his astonishing grip on layam or thalam. There would be no dull moment in a concert by Natarajasundaram Pillai, says thavil  maestro 
Haridwaramangalam A.K. Palanivel

title: When Justice Party contemplated admitting Brahmins into its fold nearly 100 years ago
description: B. Munuswami Nayudu, the Chief Minister of Madras Presidency during 1930-32, tried in vain to admit ‘willing’ Brahmins to the party. At the party’s Nellore confederation in October 1929, he sought to amend the by-laws because the exclusion of one community had resulted in the party not being a ‘full representative’ of the Presidency

title: Remembering C. Minakshi, a trailblazing scholar and authority on Pallava history
description: She was the first woman to receive a doctorate from the University of Madras in 1936. In four years as a professional historian, she published over 30 articles and four books. In 1939, the ASI asked her to study the sculptures at the Vaikuntaperumal Temple in Kancheepuram. This work remains an authoritative reference on Pallava art

Ganguly backed Shubman Gill's appointment, praising his England performance and potential as a future leader.

Saquon Barkley injury update: Eagles star set to play against Giants tonight
description: Despite a recent loss to the Denver Broncos, the Philadelphia Eagles, Super Bowl LIX champions, are set to face the New York Giants. Star running back Saquon Barkley, who had a sore knee after the last game, has recovered and will play against his former team. Barkley expressed his understanding of football's challenges and the importance of enjoying the process.

title: Nobel Prize in Literature: Meet László Krasznahorkai - Kafka's literary heir of despair
description: Critics have called him “the Kafka of our time.” The New York Times described him as “a writer of haunting, Kafkaesque intensity.” The Guardian dubbed him “the Hungarian master of apocalypse.” Translator George Szirtes said his novels “come from the same Central European forest as Kafka’s.”

JPMorgan CEO warns investors: AI stock boom may not last; sees market correction soon
description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon has issued a stark warning about artificial intelligence risks in global markets. He believes an AI-driven stock market bubble is probable and a correction could occur within six months to two years. Dimon's concerns echo those from the Bank of England and International Monetary Fund.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
description: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: Big move! Karnataka approves 12 menstrual leaves for women employees across sectors
description: Karnataka has become India's first state to approve menstrual leave for women, allowing up to 12 sanctioned leaves annually. State minister Santosh Lad announced the progressive law, emphasizing its welfare-oriented approach for women. The decision marks a significant step for women's rights in the state.

title: Nobel Peace Prize: 4 US president-winners; where they studied
description: US President Donald Trump has been nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize amid international endorsements. This article explores the educational backgrounds of the four American presidents who previously won the Nobel Peace Prize: Theodore Roosevelt, Woodrow Wilson, Jimmy Carter, and Barack Obama. It details their academic achievements, presidential tenures, reasons for receiving the prize, and current status, highlighting their diverse educational journeys from Harvard and Princeton to the US Naval Academy and beyond.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s former Manhattan townhouse lists for $17M after 20 years
description: Gisele Bundchen's former New York City home is now for sale. The elegant townhouse in Manhattan's West Village is listed at $16.995 million. Bundchen owned the property about 20 years ago. The historic home offers refined living space and modern amenities. This property represents a piece of supermodel history in a sought-after neighborhood.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in Abercrombie NFL collection; Randi cheers
description: Brittany Mahomes has launched a stylish new NFL apparel line with Abercrombie & Fitch, showcasing custom Kansas City Chiefs outfits. The collaboration, shot at Arrowhead Stadium, highlights her entrepreneurial spirit and family pride, earning praise from fans and mother-in-law Randi Mahomes. This venture comes as the Chiefs navigate a challenging season, with Brittany encouraging fans to support the team.
